column9: Now it's your turn!Scenario:Mick Strovinski owns his own business pouring concrete. For many years he has specialized in smaller jobs like personal driveways, patios, and other jobs in residential areas. However, he has recently grown his business and wants to branch out into jobs for the city or local government.A job pouring the parking lot, driveways, and foundation of a brand new City Hall for the city of Eastlake has opened up for bids. Mick desperately wants it, but he must email his bid and an outline of the job to Mayor Johnson in order to compete for it. Here is the information he must convey in his email:The total price is $86,000, including all materials and labor.The job will take 3-4 weeks to complete.The job includes pouring two driveways: one onto Center Road and one onto Smith Avenue.The job includes pouring the foundation for the building, including basement offices.The job includes pouring the parking lot, which is 100 ft. x 200 ft.The job does not include curbs, parking barriers, or walkways around the building.The job will require six people working each day.Analysis Task:Your task is to write this email, but first look at the following questions. These will help you organize the communication before you begin to write.What is the main purpose of the email?In what order should the information be given within the email?What sort of transitions can you use to connect all of the information?How will you close the email?Once you have brainstormed your responses to these questions in your notebook, write the email as if you are Mick.

Dear Sir\ Madam, 
                                    I want to inform you that the job includes pouring two driveways and job will take 3-4 weeks.

Thanks

column9: Paraphrase/re-write the following direct quote. Be sure to use all your own words and include a citation at the end to show where the original idea came from."Taking initiative does not mean being pushy, obnoxious, or aggressive. It does mean recognizing our responsibility to make things happen” (Covey, 2004, p.75).
column11: In 2004, p.75, to initiate things independently does not mean being assertive, aggressive or disagreeable. It does not mean allowing our responsibility to make things happen.
column12: Using the same original statement, paraphrase/re-write it again, however, this time choose a section of the text to include as a direct quote. Be sure to use all your own words in the paraphrased section and include a citation at the end to show where the original idea and the direct quote came from.Original statement:"Taking initiative does not mean being pushy, obnoxious, or aggressive. It does mean recognizing our responsibility to make things happen” (Covey, 2004, p. 75).
column14: In 2004, p. 75, "proceeding things does not mean being thrusting, offensive, or pugnacious. It does mean recognizing our responsibility to make goods happen."
column15: Paraphrase the following statement into your own words. Be sure to use all your own words and include a correct citation.“Initially, the flu may seem like a common cold with a runny nose, sneezing and sore throat. But colds usually develop slowly, whereas the flu tends to come on suddenly.” (Mayo Clinic, 2019)
column17: At Mayo Clinic in 2019  "at first , the flu may appear like a common cold with a sneezing, runny nose and sore throat. But colds usually develop slowly, whilst  the flu tends to come on instantaneously."
column18: Paraphrase the original statement into your own words again, but this time keep a small part of the original statement as a direct quote. Be sure to use the proper citation at the end.Original statement:“Initially, the flu may seem like a common cold with a runny nose, sneezing and sore throat. But colds usually develop slowly, whereas the flu tends to come on suddenly.” (Mayo Clinic, 2019)
column20: At Mayo clinic in 2019, at first the flu seem like a common cold but cold develop slowly, while the flu come instantly.
column21: Paraphrase/re-write the following statement into your own words.“The ancient Roman city of Pompeii was destroyed by the violent eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE. ... Pompeii supported between 10,000 and 20,000 inhabitants at the time of its destruction” (Jashemski, 2019).
column23: At Jashemski in 2019,"the ancient Roman city of Pompeii was demolished by the violent eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE... Pompeii supported between 10,000 and 20,000 individuals at the time of its destruction."
column24: Paraphrase/re-write the original statement into your own words again, but this time select some of the original text to include as a direct quote.Original statement:“The ancient Roman city of Pompeii was destroyed by the violent eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE. ... Pompeii supported between 10,000 and 20,000 inhabitants at the time of its destruction” (Jashemski, 2019).
column26: At Jashemski in 2019, the ancient Roman city was completely demolished by violent eruption as Pompeii supported intervene 10,000 and 20,000 people.

column9: Compare the original statement with the new statements and decide if you think they are examples of plagiarism or not:Original statement:“Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much” (Rowling, 1997, p.1).New statement:The parents were proud to say that they were perfectly normal.
column11: YES this is Plagiarism
column12: Original statement:“Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much” (Rowling, 1997, p.1).New statement:The parents “were proud to say that they were perfectly normal”.
column14: YES this is Plagiarism
column15: Original statement:“Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much” (Rowling, 1997, p.1).New statement:The parents were proud to say that they were perfectly normal (Rowling, 1997).
column17: YES this is Plagiarism.
column18: Original statement:“Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much” (Rowling, 1997, p.1).New statement:The parents “were proud to say that they were perfectly normal” (Rowling, 1997, p. 1).
column21: Original statement:“Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much” (Rowling, 1997, p.1).New statement:The parents were perfectly normal, they said proudly (Rowling, 1997, p. 1).
column23: YES this is Plagiarism.
column24: Original statement:“Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much” (Rowling, 1997, p.1).New statement:The parents were deeply satisfied to mention that they were totally regular people (Rowling, 1997, p. 1).
column26: YES this is Plagiarism.
column27: Original statement:“Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much” (Rowling, 1997, p.1).New statement:There are people who place great importance on what other’s think about them. They go out of their way to brag about how they fit in and would be offended if someone thought they were strange or weird (Rowling, 1997, p. 1).
column30: Original statement:“Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much” (Rowling, 1997, p.1).New statement:Some people don’t want to be seen as different (Rowling, 1997, p. 1).

column9: It isn’t plagiarism if I pay someone to write my essay.
column11: FALSE
column12: It’s ok if I use someone else’s sentence without citing them as long as I replace a few words with my own.
column14: FALSE

column17: FALSE
column18: I can’t use anyone else’s words in my assignment.
column21: I can avoid plagiarizing if I show who’s words and ideas I am using.
column23: FALSE

column26: FALSE
column27: When I use someone else’s words as a direct quote or re-write them into my own words I need to cite where they came from.
column30: Too many in-text references look messy, so it’s ok to put a reference list at the end of my essay instead.
column33: It's ok if I can't remember exactly where I got a quote from, I can just attribute it to one of my other references. As long as I show it was someone else's idea it doesn't really matter which reference I use.
column36: Other people's words and ideas can't make up the majority of my assignment - even if I cite everything correctly.

column9: Please help us understand your goals so we can help you reach them.Please explain in your own words the reason you chose to enrol with UPI.  (minimum 500 words)
column11: UPI pathway program is the program where all students studies online and enhance the knowledge about different bachelor and degree programs. Moreover, it is a leading provider of online study programs and  gave direct pathway to ample of top universities. In addition to this, UPI is at the top where tutees get the knowledge about the cost- effective programs that deliver the choice in study destinations and degree programs. In additionally, it gives plethora of values such as freedom of thought and expression, by which person can thought easily and express his or her ideas without any hesitation express their views. Also, it  also gives freedom from discrimination because all the students studies their online program without any discrimination of caste, creed etc. Moreover, knowledge can be increased with this program because they offers ample of programs of different fields where one can enhance the knowledge according to their requirements they needed. In addition to this, they inspires towards the passion and the creativity. UPI offers benefits to students such as , they offers variety of  bachelor and master degree programs in number of fields and can receive up to two years of credit transfer. As well, students complete their programs online in their own country ans allows them to study anywhere , anytime. The programs that they offers assessment based programs where student have practical career and academic skills in their own chosen field of study. In this UPI pathway program, I choose business management course where I can get the knowledge about the business techniques and gain some experience and skills. There are many  job opportunities where I can work in multinational companies and gain some experience after completion of the course.

column24: Who your hero is and why? (minimum 200 words)
column26: My hero name is Sonu Sood. He born in 30th of july in 1973. In additionally, he is an Indian film actor, producer. As well he is a humanitarion person. He is very kind hearted person as he done many humanitarion works during corona pandaemic. He belong to Punjab State. He done Bachelor of engineering from Yeshwantrao Chavan Collage of Engineering that is situated at Nagpur. Moreover, he won many awards such as Apsara award, IIFA award in 2010 and 2012. He also appeared in commercials for Apollo tyres and Airtel. He acts in Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Punjabi films. He did a movie Shaheed-e-e azam in hindi which was very popular in 2002. He played a role of Bhagat Singh. He done many social works as in may 2020, during the nation wide lockdown. His wife name is Sonali and she is a Telugu women. The have two sons.
